title: miner.start()A bug.
body:
#### System information

Geth version: `All`
OS & Version: Linux-debian
Cmmit hash : I don't understand English very well.Please see below. Thank you.

Hello, my client pops up the following error message when miner. Start,Please don't misunderstand my intention, I am a Chinese, so I can't understand these tips.

####Recent Operation

> eth.accounts                                                              ["0xab0ac52ada5d7c224fb222e1dd595b45d58511ba", "0x2079cf3ee5a0f02194b9a15bcfab702a49a79702"]                                                            > miner.start()                                                             INFO [05-29|15:32:17.954] Updated mining threads                   threads=4INFO [05-29|15:32:17.954] Transaction pool price threshold updated price=1000000000                                                                     null                                                                        > INFO [05-29|15:32:17.964] Commit new mining work                   number=1 sealhash=843056…0dc13e uncles=0 txs=0 gas=0 fees=0 elapsed=8.809ms        > INFO [05-29|15:32:21.028] Generating ethash verification cache     epoch=1 percentage=22 elapsed=3.044s                                               INFO [05-29|15:32:24.032] Generating ethash verification cache     epoch=1 percentage=42 elapsed=6.049s                                                 INFO [05-29|15:32:27.041] Generating ethash verification cache     epoch=1 percentage=62 elapsed=9.058s                                                 INFO [05-29|15:32:30.055] Generating ethash verification cache     epoch=1 percentage=84 elapsed=12.071s                                                INFO [05-29|15:32:32.510] Generated ethash verification cache      epoch=1 elapsed=14.526s                                                              ERROR[05-29|15:32:32.516] Failed to generate mapped ethash dataset epoch=1 err="cannot allocate memory"                                                 fatal error: unexpected signal during runtime execution                     [signal SIGSEGV: segmentation violation code=0x1 addr=0x0 pc=0x3ed70]

####Error content.
Oh, I can't copy the whole content, but I can put pictures. If you want, I can release the specific information for you.
look:
![超级截屏_20220529_154531](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/93650439/170857853-7ec5b073-17ea-49c1-b55f-c8d71b7693d0.png)


Words to you{Finally, thank you for your understanding.
Please don't misunderstand my intention, I am a Chinese, so I can't understand these tips.Finally, thank you.Finally, thank you for your
}

You seem to be using an _ancient_ version of geth, built on `golang 1.11`. 
Please try with a more recent version, because we do not support very old version. 
Feel free to reopen if the problem persists.
